content: Going to create the agenda for the next ACD, but I won't automatically re-add all the EIPs we discussed today. We can keep using the same issues for the various EIPs to keep the context, but if you have an update and want it re-discussed on the next call, please leave a comment on the agenda issue üòÑ I'll add 2935 by default given we didn't get to it today üëç

author: timbeiko
content:
Aleut spec added to Eth1 specs: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/client-integration-testnets/aleut.md

1559 commit hash TBD, I asked about it in <#749160974506000444>

author: trent_vanepps
content: A response from <@!135612611923279872> on today's ACD 3074 discussion

author: trent_vanepps
content: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-3074-auth-and-authcall-opcodes/4880/61?u=danfinlay

author: ryanleeschneider
content: ^ for the "Merged" state does this imply that the support will be merged into master of the respective client?  If not we should track in this doc which branch is being used for testing.

author: timbeiko
content: <@!388751025789468672> I'm not sure if all clients will use master (IIRC Geth didn't for the YOLO networks). If that's not the case, agreed that it would be good to track in this. Happy to add it if folks let me know, otherwise anyone can open a PR against the spec to list their clients' branch üëç

author: timbeiko
content: I forgot to add EIP-3198 to the spec. Added it with the latest commit.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: There's also a series of RPC-centric EIPs related to -1559 like 3044, 3045, 3046 (I don't have an exhaustive list), might be good to include but they probably aren't _required_ for this dev net.

author: timbeiko
content: Hmm, that's a good point, but it does factor in the "how much work is London" and "how much other stuff can we add". I think that's maybe a good idea for the second devnet? i.e. get all client teams in consensus on Aleut, figure out with other EIPs are very likely for London, and then do the next one with those + the JSON RPC EIPs

author: ryanleeschneider
content: sgtm.  Exchanges, wallets, etc will need those JSONRPC changes to be able to visualize 1559 txs, but I totally agree that the consensus layer is the top priority.

author: timbeiko
content: <@418000431814279181> posted his ACD remarks on EthMagicians: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-3298-removal-of-refunds/5430/22

author: wjmelements
content: Thanks Tim. Please reply on the forum; I don't check discord much.

author: pipermerriam
content:
I wasn't in today's call.  I'm listening to it now, specifically just got through the 3074 section.  I'm still kind of surprised at the resistance, though I do respect the significance of the "possible" downsides that could occur if someone signs a malicious message.

The gains of AUTH/AUTHCALL feel significant enough to justify the risk.  The risk should be able to be mitigated by diligent efforts towards education of those developing on the application layer.  If it's not clear, I'm currently in support of 3074

content:

not sure who even manages the site / theme used lol
